titlestmt.author: Weatherly Stephan

physdesc.extent: 16 vinyl banners in four 8" x 9".5 x 63" boxes.

did.abstract: Jenny Holzer is an American artist known for large-scale public installations and light projections. The Jenny Holzer "For the City" Banners consist of 16 banners that hung in New York University's Kimmel Center windows from October 3 - 5, 2005.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The banners are arranged by titles supplied by the artist in Jenny Holzer: Redaction Paintings.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Jenny Holzer is an American artist known for large-scale public installations and light projections. From September to October 2005, her series "For the City" was presented by Creative Time, in which Holzer's works were projected onto iconic buildings in New York City, including New York University's Bobst Library, The New York Public Library, and Rockefeller Center. For the Bobst Library projection, Holzer also installed 13 printed banners in the street-level windows of the Kimmel Center for University Life, across LaGuardia Place from Bobst, which reproduced the projected images for static and daytime viewing.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: All banner images were reproduced as oil on linen paintings, and photographs of the paintings can be found in Jenny Holzer: Redaction Paintings, New York: Cheim & Read, 2006, pages 39-45, 56, 59-62.

phystech.p: The banners measure 63" long, and cannot be used for research or teaching. Instead, consult print surrogates available in Jenny Holzer: Redaction Paintings,.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In 2010, the banners were treated by the Barbara Goldsmith Preservation & Conservation Department. Treatment included surface cleaning, rolling 12 prints onto hanging dowels, and rolling 4 prints without dowels onto a tube. All prints were rolled with silicone release paper. In 2019, the rolls were consolidated into 4 rolled storage boxes and sent to offsite art storage. In 2025, the boxes returned from art storage, and the collection was arranged and described.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Jenny Holzer "For the City" Banners date from 2005 and consist of 16 banners created to hang in the LaGuardia Place-facing windows of New York University's Kimmel Center for University Life. The banners are static, printed representations of "For the City" projections made onto the facade of NYU's Bobst Library (across LaGuardia Place from the Kimmel Center). The collection contains 13 original prints and 3 smaller-scale duplicates. The 3 duplicates represent prints that were made by Holzer to test-fit within the Kimmel windows; during installation, the larger prints were used.

The banners consist of United States government documents released through the Freedom of Information Act. The documents printed on the banners detail human rights abuses committed by the United States military and Department of Defense contractors at Guantánamo Bay Detention Center in Cuba, and in Iraq at the start of the Iraq War. The documents were created between 2003 to 2004 and discuss the use of torture during interrogation and detainment, describing individual interrogations, witness accounts of torture, and official discussion seeking permission to use these tactics. The documents contain numerous redactions of identifying information about detainees and the authors and recipients of the documents.
